question.body: A test has a p-value of .0436. Which of the following is true?

multiple_choice.choice: (a) For any level of significance that is below .0436, Ho is rejected.
(b) For any level of significance that is below .0436, Ho is not rejected.
(c) For any level of significance that is above .0436, Ho is rejected.
(d) For any level of significance that is above .0436, Ho is not rejected.

response.feedback: Incorrect. If the significance level is set at a value below .0436, say .03, the p-value of .0436 will be above the significance level, and therefore not considered small enough to reject Ho.
Incorrect. While the statement in the option you chose is correct, it is not the only correct statement.
Incorrect. While the statement in the option you chose is correct, it is not the only correct statement.
Incorrect. If the significance level is set at a value above .0436, say .05, the p-value of .0436 will be below the significance level, and therefore will be considered small enough to reject Ho.

Good job! Indeed, both statements, (b) and (c) are correct: If the significance level is set at a value below .0436, say .03, the p-value of .0436 will be above the significance level, and therefore not considered small enough to reject Ho. Also, if the significance level is set at a value above .0436, say .05, the p-value of .0436 will be below the significance level, and therefore will be considered small enough to reject Ho.
